data.body:

All tests remain passing.

data.title: Backwards tab order in New Project dialog.

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Tab order appears to be backwards on the new project dialog.

### How to reproduce [Bugs]

1. Open Duality Editor
2. Click "Project Folder" text box
3. Hit Tab, repeat hitting tab.

### Workaround [Bugs]

1. Open Duality Editor
2. Click "Project Folder" text box
3. Hit **SHIFT** + Tab, repeat hitting **SHIFT** + Tab.

### Attachments

[Gif illustrating tab order in New Project](http://i.imgur.com/3BLFceE.gif)

Relatively minor issue, something i noticed right away when trying out Duality.

Windows 10 Pro 64-bit (10.0, Build 15063) if needed.

data.title: Introduce a Way to Adjust the Duality Coordinate System and Internal Unit Conversion Rates for Advanced Users

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

Duality currently uses a world space unit scale that has been chosen to match pixels at 1:1 camera zoom. While nice for some games, this [screws up a significant number of physics conversion rates](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/257) and is a somewhat arbitrary choice for most other games. Investigate whether it makes sense to switch all of Duality over to a MKS (meter-kilogram-second) scale.

### Analysis

This issue is to be investigated and discussed. Whether or not it should be implemented still needs to be figured out. Feedback appreciated, please join the discussion in the comments.

#### What that means

- It will change the base units for length, time and mass to be based on meters, seconds and kilograms.
- Physics conversion rates would flatline to `1.0f` for all units.
- Audio conversion rates would flatline to `1.0f` for all units.
- Implementing this will break all serialized and hardcoded values from the old coordinate system.
- Rendering and audio would be adjusted to operate on scaled spatial units.
- Changing the spatial scaling factor afterwards will not be a breaking change and could be adjusted on a per-game, per-scene or even per-camera basis.

#### Things to take note of

- To mimic the current relation between physics and rendering scale, the scaling factor should default to 100, meaning that one unit (meter) is going to be scaled up to span 100 pixels at 1:1 zoom.
- It will be a downgrade for games or gamedevs who prefer a pixel based coordinate system, while being an upgrade for those working with physics a lot.
- It will make the scale of units more intuitive. Examples:
  - Before: `1.6666 pixels / frame`
  - Before: `2.7777 decigram * pixels / frame²`
  - After: `1 unit / second`
  - After: `1 kg * units / second²`
- The scaling factor could be adjusted as seen fit by the game.
  - For example, a 32x32 tile based RPG could specify that one tile is 1m², defining the rendering scale as 32 and essentially using a world space coordinate system where one unit equals one tile.
  - Setting a scaling factor of one would make it a pixel-based coordinate system like before, but that's not to be recommended, since physics will be less accurate while only gaining a bit of editor convenience in exchange.
  - The default scaling factor should be useful / good enough that changing it could be considered advanced.

#### What needs to be done

- Adjust all sample project Scenes and Prefabs.
  - Object positions, Transform.Pos
  - Gravity
  - RigidBody mass overrides
  - RigidBody Joint properties
  - Any property value relating to velocity, force, impulse or similar.
  - Would probably be easiest to write a script that does the grunt work automatically.
- Adjust all sample project code.
  - Hardcoded physics-related values.
  - Also distances, offsets, positions.
- Adjust physics settings.
  - Velocity threshold.
- Adjust core code
  - Absolute anchors for min-max audio ranges.
- Adjust Camera and SoundListener code to use a scaling factor.
  - Find a good place to store the default of that scaling factor, as it needs to be used by the Camera View, as well as all other runtime-generated Cameras and SoundListeners.
  - A global default might be a good start.
- Figure out how to auto-create a SpriteRenderer, and similar situations.
  - The SpriteRenderers rect will be set automatically, but the right size will no longer be the image size in pixels, but a world space size that, given the scaling factor, would be rendering as the image size.
  - That kind of conversion might show up more often. Would be good if there was a somewhat common place to ask for the "current" (whatever that means) scaling factor.
  - Also, what happens when creating a sprite prefab in a project with scaling factor A and re-using it in a project with scaling factor B? Its rect will be off. Is there a way around this? Is it likely to be a real-world problem?

#### How to proceed

- Discuss the pros and cons of this potential change.
- Figure out pitfalls and how to solve them.
- If actually deemed a likely enough improvement, branch off of the `develop-v3.0` branch to implement a prototype.

data.title: Extract a Portable Editor Base Library for Platform Independent Custom Tooling Support

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: New systems and modules requiring a significant amount of long-term effort.

data.body:
At the moment importing and exporting assets is hardly integrated in the duality editor. 
On Linux and Mac you can't use the editor, because of WinForms-dependencies. 

It's possible to develop games without the editor, but the asset management is kindly hard without it.

So my suggestion is to extract all asset management stuff to an console tool with nice command line commands.

Later on a UI could be written for Linux and Mac which would just call some those command line commands.
(e.g. http://www.mono-project.com/docs/gui/gtksharp/)

milestone.title: General

data.body: Implements issue #503. The former auto-resize logic has been removed as the zoom level can be set manually.

data.title: Fix IUniqueIdentifyable Implementations to Not Rely on GetHashCode

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Right now, Component and GameObject rely on GetHashCode to produce the same result for the same value across different runs. While true for now, this is not guaranteed to be true across runtimes and could one day cause problems. Change the implementations to not rely on GetHashCode.

### Analysis

- It's a problem specifically in the case of `IUniqueIdentifyable`, because the returned value of `PreferredId` is used for persistence.
- It will not cause errors, but may cause a complete restructuring of Scene and Prefab files on every save, killing version control usability.
- Spotted in the following code:
  - [GameObject](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/bb9ad80b32a62c5ad9d2ed977ba66f8b72f8a0e6/Source/Core/Duality/GameObject.cs#L253-L256)
  - [Component](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/bb9ad80b32a62c5ad9d2ed977ba66f8b72f8a0e6/Source/Core/Duality/Component.cs#L136-L150)
  - Others? Investigate!

data.title: Add Global .editorconfig to Duality

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

By far the most common mistake in Pull Requests is using spaces for indentation, rather than tabs. While it is possible to [add a Roslyn Analyzer to report this as an error](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/298) at some point, a more constructive solution would be to provide an `.editorconfig` file that automatically adjusts the IDE setting to indent with tabs for this project.

### Analysis

- EditorConfig support is integrated natively into VS starting VS 2017. For versions before that, an extension is required - otherwise, `.editorconfig` will simply be ignored.
- Example how to use it: See [this project](https://github.com/godarklight/DarkMultiPlayer/blob/b06660a3bf7f62a84a0aa8cc83f06344a010c4a7/.editorconfig).
- This does not make the above linked analyzers solution obsolete, but it makes it easier for users to not make this mistake in the first place.

data.title: "Package to Zip" Option Produces Invalid .zip File for Unix Systems

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

As described in [this comment](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/issues/287#issuecomment-301913468), the "pack to zip" option of the "Publish Game" function appears to cause problems on platforms that use a different path separator char than Windows.

### Workaround

Manually pack the resulting executable into a .zip file using the tool of your choice.

### Analysis

No idea why this would happen. This needs investigation, probably some Google research on .Net Compression API.

data.title: Write PackageManager Tests

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The PackageManager is a vital component of the Duality editor, as it is the primary way to install and update core, editor and plugins. However, there are no automated tests yet, which definitely should change before doing any major modifications to the system.

### Analysis

- There is nothing static in `PackageManager` and it accepts target directories to work in, so it should be possible to instantiate one in isolation during the test and then investigate its folders for expected file and file contents.
- The test should take place with a temporary, local package repository containing only fake packages. No network connection should be required for the tests to be run. No actual NuGet repository reference.
- Part of the test code will probably be using the NuGet API to create fake NuGet packages.
- It may be beneficial to factor out some self-contained code parts out of `PackageManager` in the course of solve this issue.
- Test candidates:
  - Installing a package
  - Uninstalling a package
  - Updating a package
  - Some special cases of the above where the package in question has dependencies
  - Issue #527 
  - Others?

data.title: Write RigidBody / Physics Unit Tests

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

There are already unit tests that check some basic cloning / copying functionality, but there are none that test actual physics and transformation behavior. Add a few basic tests to ensure physics works properly.

### Analysis

- The basic test layout could be to create a scene, make it current and simulate a certain number of frames with a fixed timestep, similar to the sandbox single-frame step.
- Tests could include:
  - A ball falling down onto a platform.
  - Non-static bodies not depending on parent transform, unless `AllowParent` was set to true.
  - Probably lots of others, including properties, joints, etc., but keep it short and simple for now.

data.title: Fix Package Update Build Script to Allow GitHub Issue References

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The build script that updates NuGet package specs and crawls git history to generate changelogs currently interprets all hashtags as state change tags (ADD / REMOVE / CHANGE / FIX / ...) regardless of the actual content or position in the text. This leads to parsing errors in issues references such as #532.

### Analysis

- This should be a simple fix.
- Could be done by filtering out tag candidates that don't contain letters.

data.title: Remove RigidBody Force-IgnoreParent

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Right now, a RigidBody [forces its Transforms `IgnoreParent` setting to true](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/659734426ca0d4dfa74bb701759270dbfdec6d84/Source/Core/Duality/Components/Physics/RigidBody.cs#L1143), which may be a reasonable default, but not a good general-purpose constant. One thing that this makes impossible is using child objects as sensors. Favoring control over restricting users to a safe subset, this should be removed.

### Analysis

- Changing this behavior would normally be a breaking change and warrant being on the v3.0 milestone, but thankfully `IgnoreParent` is serialized - which means that nothing will change for existing scenes.
- It would make sense to activate `IgnoreParent` once in the RigidBodies `AddToGameObject` handler, so objects start off with a good default both in the editor and at runtime.
- Double-check whether this breaks any of the physics samples. If it does, investigate why and move this to the v3.0 milestone when necessary.
- Add a physics sample where a GameObject uses child objects as sensors.

data.title: RigidBody Vertex Editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Pull Request Checklist

_This is a reminder on a few important traits of your Pull Request. **Do not add this to your description**._

- Have you read the [**wiki article** on contribution](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/wiki/How-to-Contribute)? : Yes
- Have you done your changes in a **PR-specific branch**? If not, create one and pull your changes into it before submitting. In case your PR gets rejected, your `master` branch won't be out of sync. : What? Sorry. No idea. Not used to GitHub. Should I? How?
- Have you checked **spaces and tabs**? Use tabs for indentation and spaces for alignment. : Yes
- Does your **code style** match Duality code style? : Not sure
- Have you **documented public API** you added or changed? : No
- Have you **tested thoroughly** forfunctionality, stability and usability? : Yes
- Do all of your changes and additions comply with the **comply with the [project license](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/master/LICENSE)**? : Yes

data.title: Introduce an AnglePropertyEditor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

It's a somewhat common case to specify angles in the inspector. However, radian angles as used throughout Duality are not easily readable by humans. There should be a specialized property editor for angles that allows to switch between radians and degrees and defaults to degrees.

### Analysis

- Note that issue #528 is a prerequisite to this.
- The editor should feel like an "extended numeric editor", so nothing entirely new. Same float field, limits, dragdrop, etc.
- There should be a unit label (deg / rad) with a button area of some sort for switching units.

data.title: Introduce an EditorTypeTag Property for Choosing More Specialized PropertyEditors

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Some properties might be better handled by more specialized editors than their type suggests - like a float values that expresses an angle that should be handled by a specialized angle editor. There should be a way for core plugins to express custom specialization on a per-property basis for editor plugins to evaluate.

### Analysis

- The direction of information flow should be from core to editor. 
  - A core plugin should not have any knowledge about available editor types. 
  - Instead, an editor plugin may evaluate information from the core plugin to act accordingly.
- An `EditorTypeTag` attribute could specify a string tag for a property or field.
- The editor selection algorithm could then evaluate the members `EditorTypeTag` attributes in some way to make a choice. Maybe by adding a priority boost for editors that can handle a type, but also match one of its tags?
- This should also be exposed through `PropertyEditorAssignment` attributes in some way to allow editor plugins to easily specify a property editors specialization preference.
- A common case will be to define a property editor for a type that should never be used, except if it matches one of the tags.

data.title: Fix PackageManager Re-Install Loop In Conflicting Dependency Situations

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

When the package manager enters a state where two different versions of the same package are installed, it will start an uninstall / reinstall loop that can only be fixed by manually removing the conflicting package.

### How to reproduce

- Initialize a Duality installation with the following package config: [PackageConfig.txt](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/files/966654/PackageConfig.txt)
- In the package manager dialog, install the Tilemaps Sample package. **Do not** update any other package first.
- After applying the update, a restart loop will be entered.

### Workaround

- Avoid conflicting dependency situations by keeping packages up-to-date and updating before installing a package that requires a newer version.
- Manually resolving conflicts by removing duplicate packages from the local repository and editing the package config xml.

### Analysis

- Installing the Tilemaps sample package above requires newer Duality packages than are installed in the repro case.
- This will lead to duplicate versions of those packages being installed in the local repo.
- Upon restart, Duality will attempt to remove the old versions of those packages, as they are not registered in the package config anymore after the update.
- This uninstall however [removes all package config entries](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/d478ea9e8be17da8a2a052133e336f1b7b8e26e0/Source/Editor/DualityEditor/PackageManagement/PackageManager.cs#L1170), regardless of their version.
- As a result, packages will be re-installed on the next editor restart.
- Unclear: It appears that different versions of the dependency package will be installed in an alternating sequence. Not entirely sure why this happens or how it interacts with the other issues.
  - Check what happens when installing a package that depends on an old version of an already-installed package.
  - There may be a similar issue on installs, where [any other version is replaced](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/d478ea9e8be17da8a2a052133e336f1b7b8e26e0/Source/Editor/DualityEditor/PackageManagement/PackageManager.cs#L1183) by a newly installed package version, regardless of whether it is newer or not.
- This might be a good opportunity to start writing PackageManager tests.

data.title: Cannot edit Component's string property in sandbox mode

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

I'm not sure if editing properties in sandbox mode is supported, but here it is:
In sandbox mode, editing a `string` property in the Object Editor will crash Dualitor, if the former value was `null`.

### How to reproduce

- Create a simple component with a non pre-initialized `string` property.
- Add the component to the scene.
- Enter sandbox mode.
- Click in the new property's text field. -> crash

### Workaround

- Don't edit in sandbox mode.

### Fix

- `null` check [here](https://github.com/AdamsLair/winforms/blob/5b09f012ad5bb16ea5c57a3355899008836e49fe/WinForms/PropertyEditing/EditorTemplates/StringEditorTemplate.cs#L71).

### Attachments

```
[Edit] ERR: NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
            CallStack:
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.Templates.StringEditorTemplate.get_SelectedAll()
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.Templates.StringEditorTemplate.set_Text(String value)
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.Editors.StringPropertyEditor.OnGetValue()
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.PropertyEditor.PerformGetValue()
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.MemberwisePropertyEditor.OnGetValue()
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.PropertyEditor.PerformGetValue()
               at Duality.Editor.Plugins.Base.PropertyEditors.GameObjectOverviewPropertyEditor.OnGetValue() in F:\GameDevelopment\Duality\source\duality\Source\Plugins\EditorBase\PropertyEditors\GameObjectOverviewPropertyEditor.cs:line 67
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.PropertyEditor.PerformGetValue()
               at AdamsLair.WinForms.PropertyEditing.PropertyGrid.UpdateFromObjects(Int32 scheduleMs)
               at Duality.Editor.Plugins.ObjectInspector.ObjectInspector.EditorForm_AfterUpdateDualityApp(Object sender, EventArgs e) in F:\GameDevelopment\Duality\source\duality\Source\Plugins\EditorModules\ObjectInspector\Modules\ObjectInspector.cs:line 173
               at System.EventHandler.Invoke(Object sender, EventArgs e)
               at Duality.Editor.DualityEditorApp.OnUpdatingEngine() in F:\GameDevelopment\Duality\source\duality\Source\Editor\DualityEditor\DualityEditorApp.cs:line 1111
               at Duality.Editor.DualityEditorApp.Application_Idle(Object sender, EventArgs e) in F:\GameDevelopment\Duality\source\duality\Source\Editor\DualityEditor\DualityEditorApp.cs:line 1292
               at System.Windows.Forms.Application.ThreadContext.System.Windows.Forms.UnsafeNativeMethods.IMsoComponent.FDoIdle(Int32 grfidlef)

data.title: Editor crashed on startup due to OpenTK-Exception
data.body:
### Summary

The editor is crashing every time when I'm starting Dualitor on my laptop.

### Specs

````
Summary
		Operating System
			Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB 64-bit
		CPU
			Intel Mobile Core 2 Duo T7300 @ 2.00GHz	68 °C
			Merom 65nm Technology
		Motherboard
			Hewlett-Packard 30BE (U10)
		Graphics
			Generic PnP Monitor (1440x900@60Hz)

data.title: Fixes issue#517

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Fixes issue #517.

Tested and all

data.title: Extend Canvas.DrawVertices to Allow Specifying Vertex Count

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

`IDrawDevice` allows to add vertices with a re-used buffer array while [specifying the number of vertices](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/36529f485a4e5f50a705a3c702c552e42e4df113/Source/Core/Duality/Drawing/IDrawDevice.cs#L131). `Canvas.DrawVertices` is designed as a simple pass-through method, [but has no similar API](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/36529f485a4e5f50a705a3c702c552e42e4df113/Source/Core/Duality/Drawing/Canvas.cs#L108). This should be extended.

### Analysis

- Note: Only invoke the canvas transformation for the used part of the vertex buffer.

data.title: Duality Editor crashes in VM
data.body:
### Summary

I'm on a linux machine (Linux Mint 18) and set up Windows 10 in virtual box.
(3D acceleration is enabled)

data.title: Add an option to set the rendering size of Game View windows

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

It would be useful to have an option to set the size of undocked view windows to see the real result when the external view is a camera.

### Analysis

- This feature would be useful to test different resolutions in the editor.
- It could be added in the view toolbar (see attached mockup).

### Attachments

![undockedviewsize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25836331/24510139/9f614f4e-1568-11e7-83e9-f4247cc1c88d.png)

data.title: Introduce a Build Pipeline

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

Building a Duality game ("Publish Game") is currently a very hardcoded process. Replace this with an extensible, modular build process that is configurable via the editor.

### Analysis

- The new build process should consist of a series of operations that are performed on the game data and binaries.
- Every build step is represented by a user class that implements [an interface](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/blob/d3986d43edadaba41ea1bf6dd8edeaec3cb37f1d/Source/Editor/DualityEditor/AssetManagement/IAssetImporter.cs). Each should be as self-contained as possible with the least possible shared state.
- The current build process can be refactored to form the following build steps:
  - Copy to target directory, filtered with a blacklist.
  - Move to subdirectory, create batch file to run.
  - Zip target directory.
- On the editor side, the build dialog should allow free editing of the list of build steps, including adding, removing, reordering or configuring steps.
  - Allow to maintain multiple distinct build configurations.
- The set of available build steps can be derived from all available types in all editor plugins.
- Things that additional build steps could potentially do:
  - Use IL magic to merge all assemblies and plugins into one.
  - Crawl all scenes to apply Prefabs and then remove their links to improve load times.
  - Crawl all scenes to perform additional optimization, like static batching or similar.
  - Run third-party tools for deployment on other platforms.
  - Rename the launcher file and set an icon.
  - Change the serialization format to binary, or something custom that discards compatibility features for speed.
  - ...
